questions.question: What is the primary purpose of leaching in saline soil management?
choices: To remove excess salts from the root zone
To add nutrients to the soil
questions.answer: To remove excess salts from the root zone

questions.question: Which irrigation method is considered most effective for managing salinity in crop production?
questions.answer: Drip irrigation

questions.question: What is the threshold EC (Electrical Conductivity) value at which potato yield begins to decline?
questions.answer: 1.7 dS/m

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of drip irrigation in saline conditions?
questions.answer: Increased soil compaction

questions.question: What does ET stand for in the context of irrigation scheduling?
questions.answer: Evapotranspiration

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method for determining crop water requirements?
questions.answer: Soil moisture-based scheduling

questions.question: What is the main purpose of maintaining adequate soil moisture in saline conditions?
choices: To prevent salt concentration in the root zone
To promote salt uptake by plants
To reduce water absorption by roots
questions.answer: To prevent salt concentration in the root zone

questions.question: Which of the following is used to measure soil moisture tension?
questions.answer: Tensiometer

questions.question: What is the leaching fraction in irrigation management?
choices: The amount of fertilizer applied with irrigation
The portion of applied water that evaporates
The portion of applied water that drains below the root zone
The amount of salt in the irrigation water
questions.answer: The portion of applied water that drains below the root zone

questions.question: In the leaching requirement formula LR = ECw / (5 * ECe - ECw), what does ECw represent?
questions.answer: Electrical conductivity of irrigation water

questions.question: What is osmotic stress in plants?
choices: Stress that reduces the plant's ability to take up water and nutrients
Stress caused by mechanical damage to the plant
questions.answer: Stress that reduces the plant's ability to take up water and nutrients

questions.question: Which growth stage of potatoes typically requires the highest soil moisture levels?
questions.answer: Tuber initiation

questions.question: What is the recommended soil moisture level during the vegetative stage of potato growth?
questions.answer: 65-75% of field capacity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of a drip irrigation system?
questions.answer: Sprinkler heads

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of ET-based irrigation scheduling?
choices: It accounts for weather conditions and crop growth stage
It eliminates the need for irrigation
It increases salt concentration in the soil
questions.answer: It accounts for weather conditions and crop growth stage

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign of salt stress in potato plants?
questions.answer: Leaf burn

questions.question: What is the purpose of system flushing in drip irrigation?
choices: To prevent salt buildup in the lines
questions.answer: To prevent salt buildup in the lines

questions.question: When is it often beneficial to apply leaching irrigations?
choices: During the non-growing season or between crops
Only when plants show visible salt stress
questions.answer: During the non-growing season or between crops

questions.question: What does maintaining a 'favorable salt balance in the root zone' mean?
choices: Keeping salt levels as high as possible
Eliminating all salts from the soil
Keeping salt levels below the crop's tolerance threshold
Ensuring equal distribution of salts throughout the soil profile
questions.answer: Keeping salt levels below the crop's tolerance threshold

questions.question: Why is water conservation particularly important in saline conditions?
choices: To reduce the need for fertilizers
To minimize salt accumulation and maintain soil health
questions.answer: To minimize salt accumulation and maintain soil health

questions.question: What is the main advantage of soil moisture-based scheduling in saline conditions?
choices: It eliminates the need for irrigation
It allows farmers to maintain optimal soil moisture levels
It increases salt concentration in the root zone
questions.answer: It allows farmers to maintain optimal soil moisture levels

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a factor to consider when calculating the leaching requirement?
choices: Desired salinity level in the root zone
questions.answer: Soil texture

questions.question: What is the primary goal of irrigation management in saline conditions?
choices: To increase salt levels in the soil
To reduce water usage regardless of crop health
To maintain crop productivity while managing soil health
To eliminate the need for fertilizers
questions.answer: To maintain crop productivity while managing soil health

questions.question: Why are frequent, light irrigations often recommended during the vegetative stage of potato growth?
choices: To increase salt concentration in the soil
questions.answer: To promote deep root development

questions.question: What is the main advantage of drip irrigation in pushing salts to the periphery of the wetted area?
choices: It increases salt uptake by plants
It concentrates salts where roots are most active
It moves salts away from the main root zone
It eliminates the need for leaching
questions.answer: It moves salts away from the main root zone

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential risk of over-irrigating in saline conditions?
choices: Decreased salt concentration in the root zone
questions.answer: Waterlogging and reduced aeration

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of combining drip irrigation with periodic sprinkler irrigation in saline conditions?
choices: To aid in leaching salts from the soil surface
To reduce the efficiency of the irrigation system
questions.answer: To aid in leaching salts from the soil surface

questions.question: Why is it important to consider emitter clog resistance when designing a drip system for saline conditions?
choices: To prevent salt buildup and maintain system efficiency
To increase salt concentration in the soil
questions.answer: To prevent salt buildup and maintain system efficiency

questions.question: What is the main benefit of maintaining consistent soil moisture at 70-80% of field capacity during the tuber bulking stage?
choices: To increase salt concentration in the soil
questions.answer: To support rapid tuber growth

questions.question: Why is it recommended to gradually reduce irrigation frequency during the maturation stage of potato growth?
choices: To increase salt concentration in the soil
To promote skin set on the tubers
To increase water uptake by the plant
questions.answer: To promote skin set on the tubers
